parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end.  This strongly suggests an attempt at electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used to track campaign spending and are mandated for political advertising.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "#ElenaLasconi". While it doesn't state her full name or party affiliation, the hashtag clearly refers to a specific individual, likely a candidate in the parliamentary elections.  This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags and a general message ("Singurul antidot al fricii este VOTUL") further indicates an attempt to address the public at large. This satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The core message, "Singurul antidot al fricii este VOTUL," directly encourages voting. While not explicitly endorsing Elena Lasconi, the context strongly implies a positive association.  The placement of her hashtag immediately before this message suggests an intention to influence voters towards her. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c. The overall objective is to influence the vote in favor of Elena Lasconi.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks any journalistic elements. It doesn't present news, analysis, or opinions in a neutral manner. Instead, it uses emotionally charged language ("antidot al fricii") to promote a specific candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The message is not a personal opinion; it's a clear call to action framed within a political context.  The use of the hashtag and the CMF number further reinforces this conclusion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1710189616492196</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Elena Lasconi), is intended for a wide audience, has a clear electoral objective (influencing votes), and lacks journalistic neutrality. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as political advertising.  The post's timing is crucial; even if the general election period has ended, the post's explicit call to vote for a specific candidate, even indirectly, is a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Elena Lasconi</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Teodor Lazăr, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook cu ID-ul 1710189616492196 după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care conține propagandă electorală,  menționând explicit "#ElenaLasconi" și îndemnând la vot cu mesajul "Singurul antidot al fricii este VOTUL", având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea candidatei menționate, fapt demonstrat prin prezența numărului CMF 11240015, specific campaniilor electorale, și prin natura plătită a postării.  Această postare, chiar dacă nu face referire directă la un partid, constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
